meanings.definition: To make small changes to improve the appearance of something.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys titivating her room by rearranging the furniture.
meanings.sent2: The interior designer spent hours titivating the living room before the guests arrived.
meanings.sent3: Titivating the garden with colorful flowers brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like titivating a blank canvas with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The artist's touch was gentle yet effective in titivating the old painting.

meanings.definition: The act of making small changes to improve the appearance of something.
meanings.sent1: Her titivating of the room made it more inviting.
meanings.sent2: The titivating of the store front attracted more customers.
meanings.sent3: The titivating of the cake with extra frosting made it look like a masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The titivating of the garden transformed it into a colorful paradise.
meanings.sent5: His titivating of the car's interior made it feel brand new.
